pkgmetadata.longdescription: # cfg_argparser 1.2.1a config wrapper I made.## Installation```bash# from pypi:pip install cfg-argparser# from github:git clone "https://github.com/zeptofine/cfg-argparser"cd cfg-argparserpip install -e .```## Example```pythonfrom cfg_argparser import wrap_config, CfgDictcfg = CfgDict("test.json")@wrap_config(cfg)def test_function(s: str, is_real: bool = True): # I'd advise only wrapping functions all having default methods return f"{s} is {'real' if is_real else 'fake'}"if __name__ == "__main__": print(test_function("We")) cfg['s'] = "us" print(test_function()) # Linters hate him!```## CompatibiltyThis was mainly tested on 3.9 and 3.10, but it should work from 3.6 onwards. i can't test earlier versions for some reason.
